text.section: Subject to subsection (b) of this section, on or before December 1 of each year, the Administration, in accordance with § 2-1246 of the State Government Article, shall provide an annual report to the General Assembly based on the vulnerability assessment information concerning public terminals submitted by the Administration to the United States Coast Guard under the federal Maritime Transportation Security Act of 2002.

With respect to any vulnerability concerns reported by the Administration to the United States Coast Guard, the report to the General Assembly required under this section:
Shall provide an estimate of the costs of addressing the vulnerability concerns;
Shall state the amount of any grants or other federal funds received or requested by the Administration to address the vulnerability concerns and shall include information on the status of any pending requests for federal funds; and
May not include the specific details of any vulnerability concerns the disclosure of which could compromise, in any way, transportation security.
